common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup and Account Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch, getting stuck on dependency checks, or taking a long time to boot up, especially after updates or data migrations. Account linking, particularly with Google and GitHub simultaneously, is also problematic. Suggested solutions include waiting for data migration, restarting the app, checking for missing directories, using the appInstaller build, and contacting support.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User encountered issue linking personal domain and GitHub accounts to Pieces App.
* Old account linking flow was buggy and cumbersome.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing accounts were registered separately due to software bug.
* Capitalization discrepancy in email addresses may be causing linking issue.
* User is unable to merge accounts despite several attempts.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team is actively developing a new account linking system.
* User was offered the option to meet with support or resolve issue via email or Github.
* Support representative attempted to merge accounts manually.
* User was advised to disable email privacy setting in GitHub and ensure email capitalization matches across accounts.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue remains unresolved due to likely capitalization discrepancy and limitations of old system.
* User opts to wait for the new account linking system to be released.

**Additional Notes:**

* New system is expected to be ready for production by the end of February 2025.
* Data will be migrated to the new system, allowing users to benefit from its enhanced capabilities.

related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Discussion

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users reported experiencing difficulties with PiecesOS after the major data migration in version 11.1.0. This included PiecesOS not opening, not appearing in the systray, and getting stuck on the 'dependencies scenario' tab.

**Problems Identified:**

* Data migration taking longer than expected
* Support directory missing under c:/Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os
* Issues related to the exe installer

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Wait for a couple minutes to allow PiecesOS to complete data migration.
* Restart the Pieces for Developers application.
* Schedule a call with support for further assistance via calendar link provided in the conversation.
* Provide user logs for troubleshooting.
* Try using the appInstaller build instead of the exe installer.
* Elevate the issue severity due to wider impact.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Support team continues troubleshooting and engaging with affected users.
* More users experiencing similar issues and the severity has been elevated.
* Users can schedule calls or email mark@pieces.app for support.

**Important Additional Points:**

* There are multiple comments in the conversation that have not been summarized, but they may offer further insights and information.
* Users who encounter the same issue should follow the suggested solutions and reach out to support if necessary.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

recommendations: **Prioritize 'PiecesOS Startup and Update Issues':** This is the most common and active issue category. Focus on resolving root causes of startup failures, dependency errors, and update problems, especially related to version 11.1.0.

**Improve Account Linking Experience:** Address the persistent issue of linking multiple accounts, particularly Google and GitHub. The new account linking system under development should be thoroughly tested and efficiently deployed.

**Enhance Data Migration Process:** Investigate and optimize the data migration process, as it contributes to prolonged boot-up times and potential failures. Provide clear communication to users about expected migration durations.

**Provide Troubleshooting Resources for Common Issues:** Create comprehensive documentation or FAQs addressing common startup problems, account linking difficulties, and update issues. This empowers users to self-resolve and reduces support load.

**Investigate Platform-Specific Issues:** Analyze the impact of different operating systems (macOS, Windows) and architectures (Arm, Intel) on PiecesOS performance and stability. Address any platform-specific bugs or compatibility issues.

**Monitor and Analyze Support Ticket Trends:** Implement a system for tracking and analyzing support ticket data to identify recurring issues, emerging trends, and areas for improvement in the product or support processes.
